intro: Epicharis densevestita, commonly known as the dense-cloaked epicharis, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that provide it with a unique appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along the forest floor. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
